title: Blog Post Outline Generator
description: Create comprehensive blog post outlines with SEO optimization
content:
Create a detailed blog post outline for "[TOPIC]".

Target audience: [AUDIENCE]
Tone: [TONE]
Word count goal: [COUNT]

Include:
- Compelling headline with SEO keywords
- Introduction hook
- 5-7 main sections with subsections
- Key points for each section
- Conclusion with CTA

Make it engaging and SEO-optimized.

example.input:
Topic: Remote Work Productivity
Audience: Software developers
Tone: Professional but friendly
Word count: 2000
example.output:
**Headline:** "10 Proven Strategies to Boost Your Remote Work Productivity as a Developer"

**Introduction:** Hook with surprising statistic about remote work productivity...

**Section 1:** Setting Up Your Workspace
- Ergonomic considerations
- Distraction-free environment
- Essential tools and software

**Section 2:** Time Management Techniques
- Pomodoro technique for coding
- Time-blocking strategies
- Task prioritization methods

[Continue with 5 more sections...]

tips: Include any keywords you want to target

title: Social Media Post Generator
description: Generate engaging social media posts for any platform
content:
Create a [PLATFORM] post about [TOPIC].

Brand voice: [VOICE]
Target audience: [AUDIENCE]

Include:
- Attention-grabbing hook
- Clear value proposition
- Call-to-action
- Relevant hashtags (3-5)
- Emoji usage (sparingly)

Keep it under [CHARACTER_LIMIT] characters.

example.input:
Platform: LinkedIn
Topic: AI tools for productivity
Voice: Professional and helpful
Audience: Business professionals
Goal: awareness
Character limit: 300
example.output:

âœ… Notion AI for note-taking
âœ… Grammarly for writing

Result? 40% faster output, better quality.

What's your favorite AI productivity tool? Drop it below! ðŸ‘‡

#AI #Productivity #BusinessTools #Innovation

tips: Match the platform's tone and style

title: Email Campaign Generator
content:
Create an email campaign for [PRODUCT/SERVICE].

Campaign type: [TYPE] (welcome, nurture, promotional, re-engagement)
Target audience: [AUDIENCE]
Goal: [GOAL]

Structure:
- Subject line (3 options)
- Preheader text
- Email body with:
  - Opening hook
  - Value proposition
  - Social proof
  - Clear CTA
  - P.S. section

Tone: [TONE]
Length: [LENGTH]

example.input:
Product: Online course on digital marketing
Type: nurture
Audience: Small business owners
Goal: drive course enrollment
Tone: helpful and encouraging
Length: medium
example.output:
**Subject Lines:**
1. "The #1 mistake killing your online presence"
2. "Why 90% of small businesses fail at digital marketing"
3. "Your digital marketing roadmap (free inside)"

**Preheader:** Don't let your competition get ahead...

**Email Body:**
Hi [Name],

I've worked with 500+ small businesses, and I see the same mistake over and over...

[Continue with full email structure...]

title: Ad Copy Generator
description: Generate high-converting ad copy for any platform
content:
Create ad copy for [PRODUCT/SERVICE] on [PLATFORM].

Campaign objective: [OBJECTIVE] (awareness, traffic, conversions, etc.)
Target audience: [AUDIENCE]
Budget: [BUDGET]

Create:
- Headline (3 variations)
- Description (2 variations)
- Call-to-action
- Key benefits (3-5)
- Pain points to address

Tone: [TONE]
Character limits: [LIMITS]

example.input:
Product: Project management software
Platform: Google Ads
Objective: conversions
Audience: Small business owners
Budget: $1000/month
Tone: professional and results-focused
example.output:
**Headlines:**
1. "Stop Losing Money on Disorganized Projects"
2. "Project Management That Actually Works"
3. "Get Projects Done On Time, Every Time"

**Descriptions:**
1. "Join 10,000+ businesses using our simple project management tool. Free trial, no credit card required."
2. "Finally, a project management solution that your team will actually use. See results in 24 hours."

**CTA:** Start Free Trial
**Benefits:** Easy setup, team collaboration, real-time tracking, mobile access

title: Code Documentation Generator
description: Generate comprehensive code documentation and comments
content:
Generate documentation for this [LANGUAGE] code:

```[LANGUAGE]
[CODE]
```

Include:
- Function/class description
- Parameter documentation
- Return value explanation
- Usage examples
- Error handling notes
- Performance considerations

Style: [STYLE] (JSDoc, Sphinx, etc.)
Detail level: [LEVEL] (basic, comprehensive, expert)

example.input:
Language: Python
Code: def calculate_fibonacci(n):
    if n <= 1:
        return n
    return calculate_fibonacci(n-1) + calculate_fibonacci(n-2)
Style: Google docstring
Level: comprehensive
example.output:
"""
Calculate the nth Fibonacci number using recursion.

Args:
    n (int): The position in the Fibonacci sequence (0-indexed).
        Must be a non-negative integer.

Returns:
    int: The nth Fibonacci number.
        F(0) = 0, F(1) = 1, F(n) = F(n-1) + F(n-2)

Raises:
    ValueError: If n is negative.
    RecursionError: If n is too large (typically > 1000).

Example:
    >>> calculate_fibonacci(10)
    55
    >>> calculate_fibonacci(0)
    0

Note:
    This implementation uses recursion and has O(2^n) time complexity.
    For better performance with large numbers, consider iterative approach.
"""

title: Code Review Assistant
description: Get AI-powered code review suggestions and improvements
content:
Review this [LANGUAGE] code and provide feedback:

```[LANGUAGE]
[CODE]
```

Focus on:
- Code quality and best practices
- Performance optimizations
- Security vulnerabilities
- Readability and maintainability
- Error handling
- Testing recommendations

Style guide: [STYLE_GUIDE]
Experience level: [LEVEL] (junior, mid, senior)

title: Business Plan Generator
description: Create comprehensive business plans and strategies
content:
Create a business plan for [BUSINESS_TYPE] in the [INDUSTRY] industry.

Business name: [NAME]
Target market: [MARKET]
Funding needed: [FUNDING]
Timeline: [TIMELINE]

Include:
- Executive summary
- Market analysis
- Competitive analysis
- Marketing strategy
- Operations plan
- Financial projections (3 years)
- Risk assessment
- Funding requirements

Format: [FORMAT] (executive, detailed, pitch deck)

example.input:
Business type: SaaS platform
Industry: project management
Name: TaskFlow Pro
Market: small to medium businesses
Funding: $500,000
Timeline: 18 months
Format: detailed
example.output:
**Executive Summary**
TaskFlow Pro is a cloud-based project management platform designed specifically for SMBs...

**Market Analysis**
- Total Addressable Market: $4.2B
- Serviceable Addressable Market: $1.1B
- Target customer segments: 50-500 employee companies

**Competitive Analysis**
- Direct competitors: Asana, Monday.com, Trello
- Competitive advantage: AI-powered automation

[Continue with full business plan structure...]

title: Market Research Analyzer
description: Analyze market data and generate insights
content:
Analyze the market research data for [PRODUCT/SERVICE] in [MARKET].

Data provided:
[DATA]

Provide analysis on:
- Market size and growth trends
- Customer segments and personas
- Competitive landscape
- Opportunities and threats
- Pricing analysis
- Distribution channels
- Recommendations

Format: [FORMAT] (executive summary, detailed report, presentation)

example.input:
Product: Electric vehicles
Market: European automotive
Data: Market size $45B, 15% annual growth, 12 major competitors
Format: executive summary
example.output:
**Market Overview**
The European EV market is experiencing rapid growth with a 15% CAGR, driven by government incentives and environmental regulations...

**Key Insights:**
1. **Market Size**: $45B with strong growth trajectory
2. **Customer Segments**: Early adopters (25%), mainstream (60%), price-sensitive (15%)
3. **Competitive Landscape**: Tesla leads premium segment, local manufacturers dominate mid-market

**Recommendations:**
- Focus on charging infrastructure partnerships
- Target mainstream segment with competitive pricing
- Leverage government incentive programs

title: Creative Story Generator
description: Generate creative stories, scripts, and narratives
content:
Write a [GENRE] story about [THEME].

Characters: [CHARACTERS]
Setting: [SETTING]
Length: [LENGTH] (short story, novella, screenplay)
Tone: [TONE]
Target audience: [AUDIENCE]

Include:
- Compelling opening
- Character development
- Plot structure (beginning, middle, end)
- Dialogue (if applicable)
- Theme exploration
- Satisfying conclusion

Style: [STYLE]

example.input:
Genre: Science fiction
Theme: time travel consequences
Characters: A scientist and their past self
Setting: Near-future laboratory
Length: short story
Tone: thought-provoking
Audience: adults
Style: literary
example.output:
**The Paradox Protocol**

Dr. Elena Vasquez stared at the quantum chronometer, her reflection distorted in its curved surface. The numbers blinked: 14:32:17. In exactly three minutes, she would become the first human to successfully travel back in time...

[Continue with full story structure including character development, plot progression, and thematic exploration...]

title: Screenplay Writer
description: Generate professional screenplay formats and scripts
content:
Write a [TYPE] screenplay about [CONCEPT].

Genre: [GENRE]
Length: [LENGTH] (short film, feature, TV episode)
Format: [FORMAT] (comedy, drama, thriller, etc.)
Target audience: [AUDIENCE]

Structure:
- Title page
- Character descriptions
- Scene headings
- Action lines
- Dialogue
- Transitions

Include:
- Three-act structure
- Character arcs
- Visual storytelling
- Proper formatting

example.input:
Type: short film
Concept: A person discovers they can hear other people's thoughts
Genre: drama
Length: 10 minutes
Format: psychological drama
Audience: film festival
example.output:
**FADE IN:**

**INT. COFFEE SHOP - MORNING**

SARAH (30s, unassuming, reading a book) sits alone at a corner table. The shop buzzes with morning commuters.

**SARAH**
(thinking)
I wonder if anyone else feels this lonely in a crowd...

Suddenly, she hears:

**VOICE (V.O.)**
(whispered)
"I hope my presentation goes well today..."

Sarah looks up, confused. The voice wasn't spoken aloud.

[Continue with proper screenplay formatting...]

title: Lesson Plan Generator
content:
Create a lesson plan for [SUBJECT] at [GRADE_LEVEL].

Topic: [TOPIC]
Duration: [DURATION] minutes
Learning objectives: [OBJECTIVES]
Teaching method: [METHOD]

Include:
- Learning objectives (SMART goals)
- Materials needed
- Introduction/hook
- Main activities
- Assessment methods
- Differentiation strategies
- Homework/extension activities
- Reflection questions

Standards: [STANDARDS]

example.input:
Subject: Science
Grade level: 5th grade
Topic: Photosynthesis
Duration: 45 minutes
Objectives: Students will understand how plants make food
Method: hands-on experiment
Standards: NGSS
example.output:
**Learning Objectives:**
- Students will explain the process of photosynthesis
- Students will identify the components needed for photosynthesis
- Students will conduct a simple experiment to observe plant growth

**Materials:**
- Small plants (bean sprouts)
- Clear plastic bags
- Water
- Light source
- Observation sheets

**Introduction (5 minutes):**
"Today we're going to discover how plants make their own food..."

**Main Activity (30 minutes):**
1. Set up experiment with different conditions
2. Make predictions
3. Observe and record changes

**Assessment:**
- Exit ticket: Draw and label the photosynthesis process

title: Study Guide Generator
description: Generate comprehensive study guides and summaries
content:
Create a study guide for [SUBJECT] covering [TOPICS].

Level: [LEVEL] (high school, college, graduate)
Format: [FORMAT] (outline, flashcards, summary, practice questions)
Focus: [FOCUS] (exam prep, general review, specific concepts)

Include:
- Key concepts and definitions
- Important formulas/theorems
- Examples and practice problems
- Study strategies
- Common mistakes to avoid
- Review questions
- Additional resources

Length: [LENGTH]

example.input:
Subject: Biology
Topics: Cell biology, genetics, evolution
Level: college
Format: comprehensive outline
Focus: exam prep
Length: detailed
example.output:
**Cell Biology Study Guide**

**1. Cell Structure and Function**
- Prokaryotic vs. Eukaryotic cells
- Organelles and their functions
- Cell membrane structure and transport

**Key Concepts:**
- **Cell Theory**: All living things are made of cells
- **Organelles**: Mitochondria (energy), Nucleus (DNA), ER (protein synthesis)

**Practice Questions:**
1. Compare and contrast plant and animal cells
2. Explain the process of osmosis

**Study Tips:**
- Create diagrams of cell structures
- Use mnemonics for organelle functions
- Practice with microscope slides

title: SEO Keyword Research Assistant
description: Generate SEO keyword strategies and content ideas
content:
Conduct keyword research for [INDUSTRY/TOPIC].

Website: [WEBSITE]
Target audience: [AUDIENCE]
Geographic focus: [LOCATION]
Budget: [BUDGET]

Provide:
- Primary keywords (5-10)
- Long-tail keywords (15-20)
- Keyword difficulty scores
- Search volume estimates
- Competitor analysis
- Content gap opportunities
- Local SEO keywords (if applicable)
- Content ideas for each keyword

Tools to consider: [TOOLS]

example.input:
Industry: Digital marketing
Website: marketing agency
Audience: small businesses
Location: United States
Budget: $2000/month
Tools: SEMrush, Ahrefs
example.output:
**Primary Keywords:**
1. "digital marketing services" (KD: 45, Volume: 8,100)
2. "small business marketing" (KD: 38, Volume: 5,400)
3. "online marketing agency" (KD: 52, Volume: 3,600)

**Long-tail Keywords:**
1. "digital marketing services for small business" (KD: 25, Volume: 1,200)
2. "affordable online marketing agency" (KD: 30, Volume: 890)
3. "local digital marketing company" (KD: 20, Volume: 720)

**Content Ideas:**
- "Complete Guide to Digital Marketing for Small Businesses"
- "10 Affordable Marketing Strategies for Local Businesses"
- "How to Choose the Right Digital Marketing Agency"

title: Meta Description Optimizer
description: Create compelling meta descriptions for better click-through rates
content:
Create optimized meta descriptions for [PAGE_TYPE] about [TOPIC].

Target keyword: [KEYWORD]
Character limit: [LIMIT] (usually 155-160)
Tone: [TONE]
Call-to-action: [CTA]

Requirements:
- Include target keyword naturally
- Compelling and click-worthy
- Clear value proposition
- Include CTA
- Unique for each page
- Mobile-friendly

Create [COUNT] variations

example.input:
Page type: blog post
Topic: email marketing tips
Keyword: email marketing
Limit: 155
Tone: helpful and professional
CTA: learn more
Count: 3
example.output:
**Variation 1:**
"Discover 15 proven email marketing tips that boost open rates by 40%. Learn segmentation, subject lines, and automation strategies. Start improving your campaigns today!"

**Variation 2:**
"Email marketing made simple! Get expert tips on list building, automation, and design. Increase your ROI with these actionable strategies. Read the complete guide."

**Variation 3:**
"Transform your email marketing with these 15 expert-backed strategies. From subject lines to automation, learn what works in 2024. Get started now!"

title: Career Advice Generator
description: Get personalized career guidance and development tips
content:
Provide career advice for someone in [INDUSTRY] with [EXPERIENCE] years of experience.

Current role: [ROLE]
Career goals: [GOALS]
Challenges: [CHALLENGES]
Skills: [SKILLS]

Advice areas:
- Career progression path
- Skill development recommendations
- Networking strategies
- Industry trends to watch
- Salary negotiation tips
- Work-life balance
- Professional development resources

Format: [FORMAT] (action plan, general advice, specific steps)

example.input:
Industry: Technology
Experience: 3 years
Role: Software Developer
Goals: become a senior developer
Challenges: imposter syndrome, unclear promotion path
Skills: JavaScript, React, Node.js
Format: action plan
example.output:
**Career Progression Path:**
1. **Next 6 months**: Focus on system design and architecture
2. **6-12 months**: Lead a small project or mentor junior developers
3. **1-2 years**: Apply for senior developer positions

**Skill Development:**
- Learn system design patterns
- Practice technical interviews
- Contribute to open source projects
- Take on code review responsibilities

**Networking:**
- Attend local tech meetups
- Join online developer communities
- Connect with senior developers on LinkedIn

**Overcoming Imposter Syndrome:**
- Document your achievements
- Seek feedback regularly
- Remember that learning is continuous

title: Productivity System Builder
description: Create personalized productivity systems and workflows
content:
Design a productivity system for [PROFESSION] with [WORKSTYLE] work style.

Goals: [GOALS]
Challenges: [CHALLENGES]
Tools available: [TOOLS]
Time constraints: [TIME]

Include:
- Daily/weekly routines
- Task management system
- Time blocking strategies
- Energy management
- Distraction elimination
- Review and reflection processes
- Tool recommendations
- Habit formation strategies

Focus: [FOCUS] (time management, energy, focus, organization)

example.input:
Profession: Content Creator
Workstyle: remote, flexible hours
Goals: publish 3 articles per week, grow audience
Challenges: procrastination, social media distraction
Tools: Notion, Google Calendar, Focus apps
Time: 6 hours/day
Focus: time management and focus
example.output:
**Daily Routine:**
- 8:00 AM: Deep work block (writing)
- 10:00 AM: Break and social media check
- 10:30 AM: Research and planning
- 12:00 PM: Lunch break
- 1:00 PM: Content creation (videos/graphics)
- 3:00 PM: Email and admin tasks
- 4:00 PM: Social media engagement

**Task Management:**
- Use Notion for content calendar
- Batch similar tasks together
- Set specific time limits for each task

**Focus Strategies:**
- Use website blockers during deep work
- Phone in another room
- Pomodoro technique for writing sessions
